main event: Several unidentified aerial phenomena were sighted over the Atlantic Ocean on different dates in 1951 and 1952.
interesting points: The sightings included a brilliant light that came up through an overcast and disappeared as it went into the clouds.
No other aircraft or surface vessels were reported in the area at the time of the sightings, adding to the mystery.
The crew of the aircraft encountering the light were well acquainted with the sighting and it was considered unusual, leading to an investigation.
The light that was sighted was estimated to be about 40 feet in diameter, with no sound or trail, and it approached a plane at high speed before pulling away.
The report indicated that many illusions could easily be confused as a pilot, suggesting the potential for misinterpretation of the sightings.
witnesses: pilots and crew members of the aircraft
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
